title: I can't take it but kudos to those who can
body: I tried to soldier up but I couldn't handle it. Some of the other folks who put it on their tongue and down it with a shot of apple juice are (no sarcasm intended) heartier than me. I really tried but had to resort to 1000mg capsules.  Since I'm not a weightlifter or bodybuilder I'm hoping/banking on the decrease in potency not mattering to my little old granny body.  I'm just trying not to wither away so I think capsules are OK for me. No doubt this is better for the hulks and hunks of the world.  I agree with the previous poster who said not to compromise to meet the needs of the general public. This seems to be great for bodybuilders and such so don't change it!  Know your audience. I will recommend this to all my young muscle bound friends ( and living in Lala land, I know more than a few. :-)

title: Highly effective, but pricey
body: I have been using this product for about half a year now. As a weightlifter of four years now, I can say that adding BCAAs to my supplement stack has made a noticably significant difference in improving my bodys ability to retain muscle mass while cutting. For the amount that I use for this purpose while trying to shed this extra fat, it is a bit pricey, but it is certainly worth it. I take a seving during and after long cardio sessions, and after intense weight training. Highly recommend to anyone that has difficilty losing stubborn fat and retaining lean muscle mass. I must say though, this does not mix well, and tastes like moldy flour. Takes time to get used to.

title: I can feel the difference
body: The Apex BCAA's that I really love are rather expensive and Amazon has not been able to get them back in at the great deal they once had.  So, I went on the hunt for something to replace them.  I am a serious gym rat and lift weights, but am not professional, so want to try to keep my costs down.  Between the protein mixes and supplements I take, things get a little expensive.  I found the Now BCAA's and I do feel the difference with them; I know it if I haven't taken them and do a session with my trainer.  Being female and truly petite, I can take half the recommended amount and that does work for me.  Very happy and will keep getting the Now brand.

title: great product!!
body: This bcaa powder is the best that ive found if your goal is to build/preserve lean muscle without gaining fatalmost every other product on the market is all jazzed uo with some sort of sweeteners. so, if youre not a cream puff or a whiney little child who wants to drink nothing but sugar water if youre truely serious about sports nutrition throw some of this and about 5g of glutamine in a shaker with cold water shake like hell and drink it like a big boy it mixes suprisingly well for what it is. sure it leave a mild residue on the shaker but if it didnt and if it was palatable to the average whiney gym geek. it woupd come in a Hi-C box or a capri sun pouch. bottom line is, its pure, clean, good stuff. without trying to be something that it isnt. train hard, and enjoy

title: Great experience. Effective BCAAs.
body: This review is for the NOW Foods BCAA 240 count capsules, not the powder. So far, these are excellent - I take 1 serving (4 capsules) before exercise, and 1 serving right after, for a total of 8 caps. Each serving contains 3.2g of BCAAs. After about two weeks, my muscle density and definition has increased noticeably just by doing my regular body-weight exercises and HIIT. So while you can't get ripped without work, these should definitely help.

title: amazing
body: i take 4 of these on an empty stomach before a workout. When I begin to digest them, my concentration increases OVER 9000!!!! I have experimented with a wide variety of supplements and this one of my staples. It still improves concentration if you don't go work out, I just like to be focused for workouts.

title: You're doing it all wrong
body: First I must say I love this BCAA and I like the company. You can buy cheaper from other sources if you buy larger quantities, which I probably will do the next time, but they might not be as good. I wish Now sold larger quantities at competitive prices. I'm taking off one star because of this.

title: Better off with BCAA powder.
body: These bcaa pills are great, and relatively cheap, but you're much better off going with the powder. With the powder (also by now foods) you can get a lot more servings for the same price. For the average user just wanting some more bcaa then this works great, but for the athlete who needs 5-10g preworkout, powder just makes more sense economically.

title: Not sure if it's wroth it (update: it's not worth it)
body: UPDATED: I'm posting the update on top and left my original review below, downgrading from 3 to 1 star. I think this product will land in the garbage. I've been taking it for few days now and didn't notice any improvement in exercising. I've also noticed that on the days I use it (pre-workout around 6AM) I end up feeling very tired for the rest of the day. And I mean really tired and unproductive. So I looked up the side effects of BCAA today and here's a snippet about the side effects (pay attention to "known to occur") from WebMD: "Some side effects are known to occur, such as fatigue and loss of coordination. Branched-chain amino acids should be used cautiously before or during activities where performance depends on motor coordination, such as driving." And it looks like this goes to all BCAA supplementation, not just this one. On the positive side, this means that this product is real BCAA! But on the negative side, it looks like supplementing with BCAA is not that good. A safer choice would be relying on the naturally occurring BCAA in protein shakes.

title: BCCA
body: Hard to say if it is increasing my metabolism.  I have not lost any weight. It is very bitter - I added it to a shake and it ruined my shake, so I have just been putting it in my mouth and washing it down like taking your medicine.  It disrupted my amino acid levels - which allows the cold sore virus I have to erupt - giving me cold sores, so will supplement with L-lysine from now on.  I want to take it for at least a few weeks to see if it does in fact raise my metabolism and helps with weight loss as I hoped.

title: Haven't touched the bottle after attempting about 5 times
body: As good as BCAA's are for you, I just cannot stomach this one. The taste is SO bitter and just horrendous. I know others can handle it so this is purely my personal taste buds + experience. Haven't touched the bottle after attempting about 5 times :(

title: Don't notice the difference but I am sure it is good quality
body: Hard to get past the taste. I know...I know...all BCAAs taste bad. I can tolerate a lot but I find myself skipping the addition of them into my port workout drink because I don't want to deal with the taste.  As for if they actually do anything - I find that hard to judge. I don't notice any difference in my recovery time when I used them and when I don't. I use a good quality protein isolate which inherently has some BCAAs in it so maybe that is why I don't notice a big change.

title: it's very good. If taken before and after strenuous workouts
body: I use it to this day; it's very good. If taken before and after strenuous workouts, your muscles won't ache, and they recover much faster.

title: Felt a difference once I started taking these!
body: I'm on my second bottle of this.  It took a bit of looking in stores and online to find an amino acid formulation like this.  Both my husband and I take it.  I noticed a big difference in how I felt after workouts once I started taking these.  I'm pretty addicted.  My mood seems better as well.  Will continue to take regularly.

title: Mixes great with melted coconut oil!
body: Mix this with 1 teaspoon of melted coconut oil and one drop of flavored Stevia.  It is quite tasty then!  If you practice intermittent fasting, you can still have this oil because 1 tsp = 44 calories and thus, would not break your fast,(says my nutritionist and blogger, Maria Emmerich)

title: Gives you a pump when your not working out!
body: I even take this stuff with meals and it still gives me a pump for two hours. I do workout BTW.

title: Two Stars
body: DOESNT MIX WELL AT ALL

title: Love Now Foods!
body: I use these to supplement my Now Special Two multivitamin and workout routine and absolutely love them. I love that Now Foods doesn't add unnecessary chemicals to their products, and is one of the best companies out there. I decided to go with these tablets instead of the powder, due to the taste.

title: Good Stuff
body: For no nonsense BCAA, this is one of the best values. It doesn't taste good, but it's not supposed to. I don't like BCAA's that are loaded with fillers and flavorings. Just put some water in your mouth, grab a spoonful, swish it around, and DONE. If you want a tasty treat go eat some cream puffs! =P

title: Tastes terrible, doesn't mix well, but NO ADDITIVES
body: This BCAA product is just the BCAAs.  That means it tastes like powdered aspirin and is utterly hydrophobic.  If you try and stir it in, you will end up with powder on top of water.  You'll want to order you intra-workout shaken, not stirred.  It is absolutely pure, and that is why it beats the other BCAA options. No aspartame, no treatments to aid mixing, just BCAAs.

title: YUCKY Taste that is unbearable!
body: The taste of this one is so horrid I cannot stomach it. I tried it in smoothies and just and anything to cover the flavor but it is just far to bitter for me to get down, and I have a stomach of steel! I can take a shot of Apple Cider Vinegar straight without problems, so I'm serious when I say I can handle some bad flavor, but this was really just way too much. I would suggest if you are taking aminos to go with the gel caps. I got the same brand but in caps and that works great!

title: Clean quality. Hard to dissolve and tastes like chalk
body: I'm torn on this one. I like that the ingredients don't include a bunch of crap. However, it's SO difficult to dissolve this stuff. I've even tried blending it and it still doesn't really work. On top of that, it tastes terrible--just like chalk. I'm going to keep searching for a BCAAs that I like. Please post a comment if you have any suggestions.

title: Honey helps
body: I put some in a spoon, top it off with honey, take a drink of water (leaving some in my mouth), and mix it all up in my mouth before swallowing. I know, sounds crazy, but guess what - it works! I also think the honey adds to my morning workout boost.

title: Mixing is ROUGH
body: This stuff is excellent from what I can tell as far as effectiveness (it isn't like caffeine where you feel it working) and the price is fair.  I am super tough and hardcore and all that, but this stuff it rough to mix up. It is almost like they added ANTI-mixing agent to it.  I suck it up and eat it by the spoonful directly into my mouth and swish water around to swallow it.  It is painful.  Will likely do the math to see if capsules are worth the extra money next time I buy some.

title: Great product!
body: This has really helped me recover from my 3x week sessions with my trainer!  I do not hurt nearly as bad or as long as I used to pre-BCAA's.  Highly recommended.

title: Good BCAAs, Awful Taste.
body: I believe in BCAAs, but this is the nastiest supplement I've ever tasted.  I generally can eat/drink anything if you tell me it's healthy, but this stuff really pushes my limits.  I usually drink a vegetable smoothie with raw eggs every day (never had salmonella in 25 years of doing it).  In order to get the BCAAs, I do NOT put them in with the smoothie initially.  I first blend the smoothie, then pour 3/4 of it into my glass and drink normally.  Then, after enjoying the flavor of a fresh smoothie, I go and add the BCAA powder to what's left of the smoothie in the blender, blend it, and try to chug it down quickly.  It really is awful.  I'm generally not a complainer, but this stuff tastes like aspirin powder.  It's like eating chalky medicine tablets.  But no pain no gain.  Again, I do believe in the science behind BCAAs, but just remember you were warned about the taste.  If you are a wimp, you will not like it, and you will not continue to take it.  Just blend it in a small amount of liquid so you can get it down fast, is my advice.  No flavoring (sugar, honey, fruit) will mask the taste.  You just have to deal with it, or don't buy it.

title: Great product for the price
body: Great product for the price! Two teaspoons for the amount of mg is a good deal. The taste is EXTREMELY bitter. I've tried some pretty bitter things like unflavored brown rice/hemp protein and this was far worst than anything I have ever tried! As other reviewers said, mixing it with lime will do the trick. Product doesn't include any type of scoop. I just kept a plastic spoon there for convenience.

title: These capsules go down easy and truly enhance my workouts and aid recovery
body: These capsules go down easy and truly enhance my workouts and aid recovery. I have slimmed up more on these than without.

title: Tolerable, cheap, possibly effective
body: You know, I'm slightly surprised by the claims of the other reviewers. The bottom line is that when ingesting a substance that has any plausible health benefit, if said substance doesn't have the ability to make you physically ill, then you're in good shape. I could simply have a stronger tolerance than most people, but I don't believe this product tastes poor enough to actually elicit any sort of physical nausea. That being said, it is indeed utterly, utterly unmixable. Utterly. You're probably best off just scooping the stuff into your mouth and washing it down with a swig of water. If you can do that without vomiting, you're in good shape - and I do believe you can.

title: Pure and taste great if you mix it with ice tea.
body: I mix BCAA with 4000-5000 mg of L-glutamine and 1/4 tsp of electrolytes ( make your own or buy at the pharmacy 450mg of Calcium,250mg Magnesium  and 99 mg of potassium) or 1/4 tsp of celtic sea salt to 500 ml/528 quarts/16.9 oz. Mix everything with home made ice tea. I like Rooibos Chai (non caffeinated),  or caffeine alternatives  Yerba Mate, Green Tea/Black Tea.  If you feel run down try Echinacea Tea.  I find that the bitterness flavour of BCAA lends well to ice tea. Use Stevia, or Manuka honey (probiotics), Maple Syrop or Coconut Water (good source of electrolytes). Just some thoughts I hope this helps. Everybody has something that works for them, trial and error.

I am a serious gym rat and lift weights, but am not professional, so want to try to keep my costs down.  Between the protein mixes and supplements I take, things get a little expensive.  I found the Now BCAA's and I do feel the difference with them; I know it if I haven't taken them and do a session with my trainer.  Being female and truly petite, I can take half the recommended amount and that does work for me.  Very happy and will keep getting the Now brand.

title: great product!!

title: Mixes Great... in a blender!!!

title: but then thought I would come off of them to confirm that it really was the supplements and not just the other changes I had mad
body: If you are over 50 and looking to get back into shape, keep reading. I have been taking Sheer Alpha, Sheer N.O. Booster, and B.C.A.A. together. I took them for about 30 days and saw the benefit, but then thought I would come off of them to confirm that it really was the supplements and not just the other changes I had made (feeling better just from working out) or some sort of placebo effect (my mind reacting to the act of taking a pill).  I did not go through withdrawals or anything like that, but I did see a definite difference in how long it took my body to recover, so I went back onto them. It is nice to wake up in the morning with stiffness again. (The Alpha has done that)

title: AWESOME!
body: I started using this product about a month ago. I bought it because I have been using Sheer Strength Thermogenic and have been extremely pleased with the results. Again, Sheer strength has not let me down. A little background info in case you are wondwering: I am a female who is almost 47 who needs better recover. I alternate my workouts by lifting, biking 20-40 miles, run, and Crossfit. I wake up after a great workout the day before and able to get in another good workout. I am slightly sore but not like I use to be. I not only have seen better recovery but I have also seen some muscle gain and strength. I have tried many different and expensive products. I highly recommend ALL SHEER STRENGTH PRODUCTS! You can't beat the price and quality!

title: Give it a shot!
body: For a number of years I have been using A number of different Branched Chain Amino Acids BCAA's purchased from GNC or Supersupliments trying to find the product that would help me accelerate my gains in the weight room. It was a disappointment. I was told about the BCAA product produced by Sheer Strength and decided to, after researching this product, try it. I believe it has helped me out with how I have been feeling and how I have been looking. I am going to continue to use this product to see if In the long run what positive reviews that have been posted from others are true and the benefits will be noticeable.

title: Add Sheer Strength to your Supplement Routine!
body: It's been over a month since I added the Sheer BCAAs as part of my workout routine and I do feel that they are helping me with my recovery in the gym. I lift heavy weight to gain mass and my workouts can be strenuous. It is important that I recover for my next day at the gym. I usually take 2-3 days before training the same muscle groups. I feel fully recovered using these capsules. I also supplement my workouts with Glutamine, Creatine, Oolong Tea, and a plant-based protein powder to add to my post-workout smoothies. I feel that taking three of these capsules before workouts completes my supplement protocol and I wouldn't go without them. Thanks Sheer Strength!

title: Really happy with this purchase
body: Really happy with this purchase. I started working out about 2 months ago and saw decent results without supplements but figured I would try this to see if I could get better results. I've definitely look leaner and feel less sore after my workouts after adding this to my routine. I take 2 in the morning right when I wake up with a standard otc men's multivitamin and usually about 45g of whey protein. Then I take another one after my workout and I would say the results have been meaningful. I look and feel good. title: Not a large enough dose(if you follow bottle recommendation) to see gains in athletic or weight room performance.
body: In my research across the internet it appears that SHEER has changed their pill size or recommended dosage. The Amazon store listing says take two pills daily, the bottle says take 3 pills daily. For weight room or athletic performance gains experts say you should take at the very least 5 grams PER pre/during/post workout to be effective and feel/see a difference. Look it up, do some research; My mistake that I didn't before I bought these. I say that because in 3 pills you get roughly 2 grams of BCAA (1050mg Leucine, 450mg Isoleucine, 450mg Valine). To get the recommended dosage by most professionals, you need to take 9 pills to get enough BCAA, or 3x what SHEER is recommending on the bottle. Pills are convenient and why I bought them, but this is likely why most BCAAs are in powder form, you just need more than what is feasible to be taking in pill form. When you break it down in relation of cost to qty of BCAAs, you are also ahead of the game getting the powder. They do work if you want to take BCAA in pill form, just do some simple Google research as I have found that experts recommend a much higher daily dose.

title: I thought I'd give this one a try since it was reasonably priced and had great reviews. The instructions said to take them 30-45
body: I did some research on BCAAs and came across this product. I am always a little skeptical about supplements even when I read other reviews.  I thought I'd give this one a try since it was reasonably priced and had great reviews.  The instructions said to take them 30-45 minutes before a workout or if you don't workout that day you can take them in the morning for "fasted" muscles. It also said to eat clean, workout at least 3 days a week for 2-3 weeks before getting results.  However, I was pleasantly surprised how great they worked immediately and how effective they were in regards to helping with muscle soreness. I am not a hardcore gym rat but I do like to lift at least 3-4 days a week. My biggest issue is muscle soreness; it will keep me from the gym consecutive days in row.  I've been taking these supplements for 2 weeks now and they have worked immediately for me. Little to no muscle soreness the next day (especially 2 days after a workout when the soreness really hurts). And I also take them on non-workout days. I really really like them so they get 5 stars from me!

title: This Product didn't help me, but it may be useful to you - don't know!
body: I'm a total fitness trainer.  I also teach martial arts three times per week.  This product did not assist me with anything, sorry to say.  I felt a little funny and I immediately discontinued the consumption of the product.  I didn't want to take the risk.  The key point here is this:  All supplements aren't for everyone.  This product just didn't agree with me; however, it may do you some good.  I can only answer for me only.  I'm in excellent physical condition - therefore - I feel the results immediately from any supplement i take.  As a fitness addict like myself - always start out taking one tablet to determine if its for you first.  Don't over consume a product and get the results - they could have a negative effect.  Always consult your doctor, or at least get a check up after taking new supplement.  Try this product but read and do your research first.  Best of luck

title: Give this 3-6 months and you will see results like it did
body: I had a 23 day exercise streak with biking, running and lifting. I just happened to be on all three supplements together. I think in combination with the extreme stretch of workouts (not my normal) and the stack contributed to my performance. I'm 5'10" and in August had a 37 in waist and today I'm border between a 32-33 waist. This is after my second cycle of these supplements with the appropriate four week break in between. Give this 3-6 months and you will see results like it did. I say this will all my supplement reviews NEVER WILL BE A SUBSTITUTE FOR A HEALTHY DIET, EXERCISE AND DEDICATION!

title: I also started having regular strength gains when I increased my recovery periods to 5 days as recommended by Tim Ferris' "The F
body: Received my BCAA order from Sheer Strength Labs correctly and promptly. I just started taking BCAAs along with Sheer Strength NO2 and my usual whey drink and food protein. As, advertised, the NO2 increased my strength and endurance immediately adding several reps to muscle failure. As per Tim Ferris' "Four Hour Body" and Dr. Mercola's recommendation, I do only one very slow set (five seconds each way) with enough weight for muscle failure between 8 and 10 reps. I also started having regular strength gains when I increased my recovery periods to 5 days as recommended by Tim Ferris' "The Four Hour Body". I do my lower body exercises during the upper body recovery period and vice versa. I'm 78 and started resistance training to reverse or stop the muscle loss that occurs with aging. I was amazed to see muscle growth at my age. I also do (6) 16 second "all out" sprints with two minute walking rests between sprints once a week for cardio. The British research proves that's enough for cardio benefits.  I have a better body, and lower pulse rate now than ever before.  I'll write another review if and when I notice a difference in my muscle growth or strength after taking BCAA's.

title: Seems To Be Working
body: I received my products 2 days after ordering (Amazon Prime), and I started taking the BCAA & Thermogenic & MRM CLA 1250 on Sunday 01/17/2016. It's been a week & so far i have notices some changed with appetite & cravings. I think it really maybe the combination of supplements. I feel stuffed after lunch, which is salad w/ minimal carbs & dressing. I don't really feel hungry again until after my evening workout, which is around 7pm. I bought 3 boxes of Girl Scout cookies because I buy them every year & I've only eaten 4 with no desire to over indulge. So, I'm going to continue taking them until the end of both bottles, then update my review. I do workout hard 7 days week(3 strength, 3 HIIT cardio &1 yoga), so I'm always hungry, but I feel in control of my appetite since taking these.

I'm a monster in the gym right now.  I'll most definitely continue using the product.  I've never really been impressed with BCAA's, especially in a pill form, but I'd strongly recommend giving this product a try, just be patient.  Give it a few days, you'll be glad that you did.  I know I am.

I have used many products in those years and SHEER is at the top of my list as far as price, quality and most of all results.  I have been stacking SHEER BCAA, SHEER NO2 and SHEER ALPHA for 3 week.  In those 3 weeks my max dumbbell bench has gone up 25lbs.  I've had no ill side effects from these products but I do recommend taking them with meals.  Great job SHEER!

title: This really works
body: This really works, have ordered 5 bottles from sheer strength so far. I decided to take a break for a month from BCAA's and really felt the difference in my recovery, I was very sore after each workout even though i have not been when I was taking the sheer strength bcaa. It really helps to keep going all week long without being sore after each work out.

title: This is the product to use! Amazing results!
body: I have tried a LOT supplements over the past 4-5 years & I can tell you honestly that the Sheer BCAA capsules work best. You will not only see immediate results in the bedroom & in the gym, but the effects last indefinitely, unlike other products that work for a few days & then nothing.

I have had some problems over the years putting on weight and hypertention (my numbers are getting way better with stacking SS products). Nothing worked for me until I started workingout again. Becareful not to over do it because it makes you feel great. Can't wait to see the full physical results in the next couple weeks. I know there will be some because of my intense workouts. Note: I'm doing four sets (at 60%-80% lifting)each session (3X a week - chest & arms Mondays,legs & arms wed, shoulders/back and arms on Fri, cardio Tues, Thurs, and Sat). For those folks giving this product 3 stars and lower - they must be doing something wrong. THIS PRODUCT WORKS!!

body: I am 70, and have had a number of muscle issues before taking BCAA.  I don't really know all of the chemistry involved with the good results I've experienced, but the results are clear to me:

title: "Unflavored" needs to be mixed or chased with something. Works great.
body: Great product. Taking this before and after a workout really helps with muscle fatigue, especially if you are lifting while at a caloric deficit.

title: Unflavored review - Stage 2 product
body: Unflavored review

title: Does exactly what it's supposed to.
body: Was looking for a plain old container of BCAAs with 5000mg servings and a 2:1:1 ratio for leucine : isoleucine : valine and that's exactly what this is. Flavorless BCAAs that mix well into anything, I just add it into my regular pre-workout and head to the gym. It doesn't clump, it doesn't change the flavor, it doesn't have any texture.

title: Excellent not great tasting but chug it down it works!
body: Tastes a little bad however for the benefits of BCAA and because it mixes well with water and has NO artificial crap in it no gluten, sweetner or junk and seems to work I used it today before my workout and totally kicked ass on cardio and when I lifted and I am hopeful this and my routine with L Gulatimine raw will do the trick. Building and keeping muscle is my goal I am a female and need the extra boost before and after work outs so that I am not sore and fatigued after not 20 anymore LMAO. But I can say for the money and for how great I felt today it worked well. Mix it with some lemon in the water and chug it down worth it. Taste is NOT that bad compared to taking some gross s*** like Nystatin powder *anyone that has had this knows what I am speaking about this is nothing in comparison and benefits are great. Hopefully they continue to make and will sell in a larger container since a person needs to take it 2x per day to really get the benefits before work out and after. GREAT product if you are seeking to avoid added crap gluten, sugar, and artificial sweetners the poison etc

title: Bought unflavored and am happy
body: So I got the unflavored and was concerned that everyone is reporting it tasting terrible. I mixed it in flavored water and I didn't taste it at all. I put it in my decafe coffe and still didn't taste it. I dip my finger in the powder to taste it and it is slightly bitter but I don't plan on scooping up a spoonful and eating it. I'm happy with it and will buy it again

title: Good taste, but too much artificial sweetener for me to handle.
body: I give it 2-stars for the taste, but the amount of artificial sweetener really jacked up my stomach. Basically the benefits I was probably gaining from the aminos were countered by the stomach distress from the sugar alcohols. Plus the artificial coloring is a little too much for me. I probably should have read more into the ingredients list or gone with the unflavored but have found straight up aminos are difficult to take as well. Went with a different more simple ingredient list from another brand.

body: This product is absolutely unbearable. I have used quite a few ON products before, including their pre workouts, creatine monohydrate, and even their flavored BCAA. Up until this point I have been extremely satisfied with ON products. I have found them to be effective and have enjoyed their flavors. I just ordered this BCAA product and it arrived promptly. However, upon first use I absolutely could not bear this product. I used it as instructed and only used one teaspoon of the product. First, the powder leaves an absolutely repugnant taste and aftertaste. Even mixing it with a better tasting liquid did not mask the horrible taste. I would almost be able to stand the taste, had it not been for the immediately stomach ache. I got through only a few sips before I started feeling nauseous and feeling stomach cramps.

title: Stinky
body: Not that great.  Smell is awful, much worse than the other BCAA products I've used over the years.  I prefer Dymatize over ON for BCAA powders.  Blends fine, but the smell alone is a dealbreaker for me.  I use BCAA twice a day on workout days and I've been lifting for decades, so I feel qualified to say that this is not a great powder.

title: should be called 'funk flavor' - smells/tastes like Death.
body: I figured the unflavored would mix well with other products (like powdered creatine).  However the unflavored BCAA, very much has a "flavor"....should be called 'funk flavor' - smells/tastes like Death....

title: Too much fake color/flavor
body: Using this with other supplements I am getting good results but whether this alone has anything to do with it is beyond my ability to say.  It does mix good and taste okay.  My big gripe is that it tastes a little too fake, sweet, and overpowers a shake if it is mixed with other ingredients and has so much artificial color in it that it has permanently stained my shaker cup red.  Maybe I'm alone on this, but I don't think it needs to look or taste like hawaian punch to be fruit punch flavor.

title: Not worth it. Sorry

title: I work out first thing in the morning on an ...

The rest is simply consistently pushing yourself in the gym, a balanced diet, and sleep.

title: work out trainings
body: Used before endurance training, the Branched Chain Amino Acids (BCAAs) leucine, isoleucine and valine can help spare muscle. Used after strength training, they help kick-start protein synthesis which plays an important role in muscle building. ON’s BCAA 5000 Powder delivers five grams of BCAAs per serving in the preferred 2:1:1 ratio of leuncine to isoleucine and valine. It’s instantized for easy mixing into water, juice or post-workout shakes.

It also makes your hydration a bit more pleasant with the flavor.  I use it along with some creatine and glutamine powder.

title: Great Supplement for Weight Training
body: I used to have post-workout pain a lot after weightlifting. Then I tried doing a ketogenic diet and found I became very weak during and after the workout. I decided to add in BCAAs and lite salt to attempt to repair and provide electrolytes during exercise. It worked well. So well in fact, sometimes I wonder if I am working hard enough in the weight room. I have never quite felt this way before after weight training. I know I am making gains because I can handle more and more of a load over time. I use BCAAs all of the time now, not just while on keto. I think the difference now is that I am giving my body the opportunity to start repairing itself before it gets wore down and  DOMS (delayed onset muscle soreness) sets in. I am not saying DOMS has gone totally away, but it's gotten a ton better than it used to be, even when I was 10 years younger than I am now.

title: Makes my stomach sick.

title: Great so

title: This was my first brand of BCAA powder I have tried and I have tried several others now and it ranks as among the best. I'd want
body: Hard to give a raving review for BCAA powder but Optimum Nutrition is consistent with their quality so I can give them props for that,  This was my first brand of BCAA powder I have tried and I have tried several others now and it ranks as among the best.  I'd want to mention that the other bulk BCAA powder bought  on Amazon from Hard Rino was equally as good as well as a substantial savings since buying in bulk, so check them out as well.  This powder mixes well and doesn't taste great, but after a few servings I actually developed a liking for the repulsive taste of BCAA.  I have also tried Vitamin Shoppe's BCAA powder and it is good but I prefer the repulsive taste of ON version.  The VS version was repulsive but just kind of eh...  not bad but I preferred the ON BCAA.  I also bought ProSource BCAA and that was the worst as it doesn't mix well and the flavor isn't as good as either of the previous 2 I mentioned.

I love the fruit punch taste, it's a little sweeter than I expected but I just add more water and sip it as I workout. Since I started using this, I have noticed a much quicker recovery rate after heavy workouts. I definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a tasty and good quality BCCA product

title: My coach suggested trying a flavor next time like fruit punch
body: This one is the unflavored. I had never taken this product before but am taking it by suggestion of my nutrition coach for during workout and post-workout recovery. This powder is a little bitter. But placed in a regular shaker bottle full of water the taste isn't hard to get used to. If adding along with your regular protein supplement it will give a small bitter taste also. My coach suggested trying a flavor next time like fruit punch. The serving size is 1 heaping teaspoon so it will take quite a while to get thru the whole container.

title: Essential Supplement for Any Workout

title: Mixes Easily!
body: There's not a whole lot to say about BCAA's in general.  The best thing about this product, and the main reason for the 5 star rating is the fact that there's no extra stuff in the mixture, and it's fully dissolvable in liquid.  So many products out there leave a chunky and chalky white mess in your drink or shake, but this one dissolves easily with a spoon, and stays homogenous once mixed.  I use it a couple times a week when I am fasting or training on an empty stomach, and it does what it's meant to do as far as I can tell.

Perhaps it's the faux sweeteners. I tried it on about 10-12 different days without different results so I felt confident tossing the rest of the powder and going back to unflavored. However, I decided to try another brand, Bulk Supplements, in case it was actually something with the manufacturing process.

I used to order through other supplement sites, but they always killed with with shipping charges.  Now with Amazon Prime, I can usually buy it cheaper with free 2 day shipping.

title: The flavor is terrible, but the stuff works
body: The flavor is terrible, but the stuff works. I have noticed accelerated gains since I started taking this along with my weight gainer and my Glutamine powder. It does exactly what it's supposed to: it helps with protein synthesis.

title: Five Stars
body: I have no idea if this works but I like throwing money at random supplements.

title: A Really Great Product If You're A Senior Citizen With A Gym Routine
body: This is a great product, and you really notice the difference if you've been very consistent in a gym schedule format routine like I have.  Since I am a senior citizen, I notice such things very quickly along with my gym routine, and in about a weeks time, at leas for myself, you notice you start feeling brighter in your moods, something becomes positively different.

title: Best BCAA on the market IMO
body: I've tried a few different BCAA powders and this one is hands down my favorite.  I take this pre-workout to ensure that the elevated amino acid levels keep my muscles from fatiguing as quickly in the gym and regardless of brand, I CAN tell a difference in muscle stamina.

title: Great product. If you're into the super sweet BCAA's ...
body: Great product.  If you're into the super sweet BCAA's you're probably not going to like the unflavored version.  I mix it with ice cold water and down it.  You're supplementing with it to enhance your health so why would you want artificial sweeteners?  Thank you ON for providing an unflavored version.

title: 3 stars because of the horrible taste.
body: 3 stars because of the horrible taste.......really i tried to mix with large amount of water,small amount 2oz,with juice with whatever can be mixed with taste like......it provoke vomiting immediately.....but the good thing no soreness very fast recovery and it mix very fast even without shaker bottle.....but the only problem is the taste,otherwise go with the capsules.

title: Great value, mixes well, taste is mediocre
body: I buy this product regularly because it offers a great value and easily mixes with water. Also, I do not want the powders with sweeteners or other extra unneeded ingredients. It's not terrible to drink with water, but of the various unsweetened supplement powders I use this is the worst tasting.

title: Great Purchase
body: Amazing. Great taste. This is my first time trying a bcaa, and this one made me a fan. It works well during workout. It is worth mentioning that it is cheaper here on Amazon than in nutrition stores.

title: Great Product...But Bitter
body: Great product. I trust Optimum Nutrition quality and this product is no exception. It really seems to help my muscle repair. Wish I had noticed it is unflavored though because it is quite bitter. If I add it to a flavored drink I don't notice the bitterness.

title: Just as advertised
body: Not much you can say here.  Its just as advertised.  Has a slight flavor that is a little unpleasant, but not bad enough to worry about.  And if you mix it with something that has some flavor, its no big deal at all.

title: Strong flavor
body: I love Optimum Nutrition! This is a quality product!!! I use this before every single workout and I have definitely been seeing the gains stick more. I liked the fruit punch flavor originally. Just make sure you add the recommended amount of water (or more!). This stuff has a strong flavor! It’s a great fruit punch flavor but drinking it every day gets old. I’d recommend getting unflavored or get multiple flavors so you don’t get burned out on fruit punch like I did! Once again: be sure to add enough water or you’ll be in for a flavor shock!!

title: NO SAFETY SEAL
body: No safety seal...I will not be using and will be asking for a refund.  Very disappointed.

title: I love every Optimum nutrition project I have tried in the ...
body: I love every Optimum nutrition project I have tried in the past and the BCAAs are no different! I love the fruit punch taste, it's a little sweeter than I expected but I just add more water and sip it as I workout. Since I started using this, I have noticed a much quicker recovery rate after heavy workouts. I definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a tasty and good quality BCCA product

title: Good Aminos
body: I prefer powdered amino acids over pill form. I use these when pre-workout when training in a fasted state to help offset muscle catabolism. They help have free form amino acids in the blood during exercise so your body does not break down lean tissue to get them.Essential amino acids cannot be made by the body like most other amino acids so they must come from diet. All complete protein has essential aminos so if not training in a fasted state I would suggest a good whey protein supplement. Hope this review is helpful.

title: Increases workout performance
body: I purchased this for my workouts, I came across this product when I was looking for BCAAs without all the additives and sugar found in many other products. It works really well, the only downside is that it is quite bitter. I just chug it down so I don't have to taste it.

title: like Sucralose and Red #40
body: This is the appropriate mix of BCAAs, but unfortunately ON also decided to throw in other harmful fillers, like Sucralose and Red #40.  There are other brands that offer the right mix without ANY of these fillers.  Unfortunately I'm opting to return the product.  It's not worth putting artificial ingredients into your body.

title: Great for fasted workouts
body: Great BCAA powder.  Dissolves completely and the unflavored isn't difficult to chug down.  I work out fasted and take 5 grams of this  45 minutes to an hour before I get to the gym.  I have no feelings of hunger until after I get home, and I believe it helps my performance.

title: Doug McGuff recommends at least 10G before workout and 10G after with one more the next day just for good measure.
body: Buy this one to mix with the flavored one to come up with more suitable solution...this alone is tough to drink but it is effective!  Dr. Doug McGuff recommends at least 10G before workout and 10G after with one more the next day just for good measure..goes quick

title: Just as Described!
body: I've been using this product as described and am already looking forward to even more benefits that I've already felt so far (only a week or so.) I'm very pleased and will continue to monitor myself even more deliberately thanks to the energy-supplying motivation already experienced by using this product.

title: Doesn't taste bad when mixed with flavoring
body: I was searching for BCAAs for a while. The first brand I got tasted really good but it had too much sodium in it and since I was drinking it two or three times a day it was making me retain a lot of water. I then found the Optimum Nutrition BCAAs which do not have sodium or flavoring. The first time drinking it I mixed it with water and it tasted gnarly. I then started putting two packets of truvia along with fresh squeezed lemon into it and it really masked the bitter taste and actually tasted like lemonade. To mask the flavor now however I use Vega sugar-free energy packets as I drink it in the morning before my workouts.

title: Eh.
body: Solid product, not magic. Pretty annoying the price has been hiked up so much on these products, simply not worth paying over $25 for 60 "servings" of standard BCAA's. I recommend doing the number on the quantity of similar products and nutritional value and buying a different brand. Don't pay $33.50 or whatever for 60 servings, it is a waste of money and encourages greedy supplement companies to over charge for what honestly is a very basic product.

title: ... use optimum nutrition powders for training and it works great but this shipment upset me
body: I often use optimum nutrition powders for training and it works great but this shipment upset me,I ordered glutamine with bcaa and both containers where without protective sheet and without spoons, I am not sure if powder inside is ok or enough mass for the container.

title: HORRIBLE TASTE!
body: Unflavored?! Yeah right!! This stuff tastes unbearably bad. I try to chug it down as quick as I can but half of the time I end up gagging and barfing it up. It seems to make me stronger but I hesitate even taking it in the mornings because of how bad the taste is.

title: Harsh
body: VERY HARSH FLAVOR. Requires more water than recommended to be palpable. I am not sure if the product works because I haven't had it long enough to see results but the taste alone is enough that I won't buy it again

title: Tastes great and easy to mix
body: I have had great results since using this product. Since I made a number of dietary changes I can't positively say how much of my progress is due to the BCAA, but it's a part of my pre-workout ritual. Mixes quite easily and since I no longer really drink any fruit juices it kind of replaces my morning orange juice. I've come to like the taste very much.

title: Mixes Easily!
body: There's not a whole lot to say about BCAA's in general.  The best thing about this product, and the main reason for the 5 star rating is the fact that there's no extra stuff in the mixture, and it's fully dissolvable in liquid.  So many products out there leave a chunky and chalky white mess in your drink or shake, but this one dissolves easily with a spoon, and stays homogenous once mixed.  I use it a couple times a week when I am fasting or training on an empty stomach, and it does what it's meant to do as far as I can tell.

title: Great product
body: This has been amazingly helpful with my workout recoveries & overall energy levels!!  I also love that this product has no added artificial colors, flavors or sweeteners like most other BCAA products.  Who wants to put junk like that in their body especially after a workout!?

title: Good for gains
body: I've been taking this for a few months along with l-glutamine and I can definitely tell a difference in my body and in the gym. I'm a woman, and for me it was a similar improvement to creatine without the bloat. It actually energizes me. Like a cup of coffee without the jitters when you take it on an empty stomach (as directed on the product). I will be buying more.

title: Probably Works, Tastes Horrible
body: It's hard to say if this product has actually contributed to my added size/strength over the past couple of months, but as long as I'm making quality gains I'll keep using it. As for the taste, it's horrendous. Probably the worst thing I have ever tasted. I mix it with my whey protein shake, and have found that if I guzzle it then chase it with orange juice, it's not that bad.

title: Another hit from ON
body: I love ON products. This powder mixes extremely well and has a great taste. I was using it for fasted cardio, but have since stopped because I prefer eating before I work out. Exactly as advertised.

title: Optimum Nutrition BCAA Powder gets me through tough workouts!
body: This product is reasonably priced and tastes great. I drink it throughout the day to curb my appetite and prevent post workout fatigue.

title: Not the best taste out there but it's not terrible
body: Not the best taste out there but it's not terrible. Great price compared to others and really helps me push through the end of my high intensity workouts. And yes I can tell a difference in workouts between the times I do take it vs. the times I don't

title: It is what it is
body: All in all that is exactly what it says it is. The only downside is it taste the way feet smell. Other than that it mixes well. Its just for unflavored it is the most god awful smell and taste I've ever mixed with anything doesn't matter if its a juice, milk, anything it is just terrible.

title: but this is by far my favorite. It taste really good
body: I have tried a few different kinds of BCAA, but this is by far my favorite. It taste really good, its affordable and it really does help during workouts.

title: so for me to notice a loss of bodyfat is nice. Will be trying more of this
body: This is my first experience with BCAA's, and I have to say that I do seem to notice a difference in seeing no loss of muscle or strength, but definitely a loss of bodyfat. I do not do a large amount of cardio, so for me to notice a loss of bodyfat is nice. Will be trying more of this, and going to up the dosage a little

title: Great Seller Great Product!
body: Great product. When I searched online, people seem to say BCAAs don't really make that significant of a difference, however, in my case it has really help me bring my lifts and gains to the next level. Highly Recommend.

title: Good stuff for fasted training
body: Bought these BCAA since I trained fasted in the mornings before my first meal. Taste isn't great but not unpleasant, you can't ask for much more with just BCAAs. Mixes well. No problems with the ON brand so I recommend this product.

title: Great BCAA supplement
body: This is the best BCAA supplement I have tried. It mixes well (for a BCAA supplement) and is relatively tasteless. I like to mix it with usweetened Koolaid mixes like lemonade power and then sweeten with steviosides.

title: ON never disappoints
body: Great product, Optimum Nutrition always give you the best bang for your buck. I will definitely be buying this again

title: Drastic Difference
body: I started taking BCAAs for soreness and so far I haven't felt sore yet. Before it'd take 3 days for me to feel 100% again from my workout so I'm rather pleased that I was able to do 3 high intensity workouts in a row without any noteworthy aches.

title: Useful product
body: I use BCAAs with my preworkout about 30 min prior to every lifting session. I have most definitely experienced moderate gains from using this product. I feel more energized and pumped up before lifting.

title: Staple in my house
body: I've ordered this product about 3-4 times already, i love this stuff!

title: Does what it is suppossed to
body: I started taking BCAA post my workout and I can already see a difference in my muscle definition. yes it tastes horrible but I read a review that said chase to dissolve it in minimum possible water and then chase it a with a big glass of water

title: work out trainings
body: Used before endurance training, the Branched Chain Amino Acids (BCAAs) leucine, isoleucine and valine can help spare muscle. Used after strength training, they help kick-start protein synthesis which plays an important role in muscle building. ON’s BCAA 5000 Powder delivers five grams of BCAAs per serving in the preferred 2:1:1 ratio of leuncine to isoleucine and valine. It’s instantized for easy mixing into water, juice or post-workout shakes.

title: Mix with coffee for a great pre-workout mix
body: I use Optimum Nutrition BCAA's before my fasted workouts to avoid catabolism. They don't taste great, but after using other brands of BCAAs, none really do.

title: Less post workout pain
body: I am not a big fan of using many supplements but after using a little bit of these BCAAs,  I feel they are an important tool for recovery.  I would highly recommend these to anyone strength training. Best supps:  multivitamin whey protein, creatine, BCAAs.

title: GOOD, SOLID BCAA PRODUCT
body: THIS PRODUCT IS A GOOD PRODUCT FOR ANYONE WISHING TO SUPPLEMENT THEIR INTAKE OF BCAAs.  BCAAs, ESPECIALLY LUCINE, ARE THE FUNDAMENTAL AMINO ACIDS FOR BUILDING MUSCLE.  THE ONLY DOWNSIDE IS THAT THE PRODUCT IS NOT FLAVORED, AND I HAVE TO ADD MY OWN FLAVORING.

title: Great muscle recovery
body: I truly enjoy this product, I put a half a teaspoon in with my pre workout drink and then a whole serving size with my post workout protein. I am a female who has been striving for lean muscle gain, getting more cut. With the use of this product I have reached my goal much quicker than without any amino acid support. Doing research, it becomes apparent how essential the basic chain amino acids really are to aid in workouts and recovery. I liked the unflavored powder because I would just mix it with someone that was flavored already. I would recommend this to anyone who was serious about making gains/cuts in their workout routine.

title: Good stuff
body: I am pleased with the powder BCAA from ON.  I agree that it is slightly bitter, and I wouldn't take it with water, but it's not horrible.  I've had multi-vitamins taste just as bad.  I mix my ON BCAA powder with 1/4 cup of pineapple juice and drink it like a shot.  The juice is sweet and masks the bitterness of the BCAA pretty good.  I get a slight bitter aftertaste but nothing bad.  I've just started taking it last week so I can't yet speak to the effectiveness of the product on my muscle building but I'm confident it is doing what it's supposed to.

title: Mmmmmmm...
body: Love the product.  I eat it out right out of the container and actually have grown to crave it and the taste.  Call me crazy but I think it's delicious, and that fact that it's everything you need and nothing you don't is a positive for me.

title: Not bitter at all!!
body: Maybe I have weird taste buds but I was dreading the bitter taste. I mixed mine with a half scoop of C 4 energy and it tastes fine. Not bitter at all. Will review late if it helps my sore muscles from Body Beast workouts

title: Impressive quality and results
body: Works as expected, horrible taste but this product is about performance not flavor. Great for the experienced athlete or body builder.. I would not recommend this for those who just started training as it would have little benifit and would only waste your money...

title: another ON winner
body: great product so far not lot of soreness but can feel I did hit training hard. Have been combining it with RC King mass and they are great together perfect blend just shake and go

title: Tastes like crap but it works.

I use a very high quality whey protein that tastes awesome, but this makes it sort of meh. But this stuff has proven results in my workouts. My bench and squat are going up a little higher date coincident with adding a scoop to my pre and post workout protein drinks.

title: Very poor flavor. Did not disguise the flavor or the ...
body: Tried the Fruitpunch. Very poor flavor. Did not disguise the flavor or the BCAA's. Also, the red coloring used in this product got on my cuticle and took me two days to wash off totally. What is that doing to our insides?

title: Tastes fine
body: I was hesitant about getting this based on the negative reviews about the flavor, but I found it not not be anywhere near as horrible as I expected it to be. It's a bit tart... I mix it with a little apple juice and it's almost like drinking cranberry juice. As for the effects, I can't really tell if it's working. I seem to be recovering from my workouts speedily, but I also started a couple other supplements at the same time.

title: So far so good! I had never taken aminos before at all ...
body: So far so good! I had never taken aminos before at all while lifting, but I absolutely love it! It gives a little bit of an extra pump if taken before gym & it makes you recover much better than without it. I think I am hooked & I like how clean these aminos are.

title: Great taste & results
body: Tastes great! Just like fruit punch. Dissolves easily. I believe it works- I drink it after every workout & have built up muscle. I have noticed others at my crossfit box use the same brand and have re-ordered a second tub.

title: Makes whatever you add it into bitter. Drink in ...
body: Makes whatever you add it into bitter. Drink in plain water if you're hardcore I guess.

title: Crucial for athletes and recovery. Wish it tasted better, but man/woman up, if you can workout you can take it.
body: Was shipped fast, arrived as expected. Crucial for people trying to build muscle recovery. Yes it doesn't have a great taste (bitter) but if you can take a shot of alcohol than this isn't a problem. I just add it in with my protein shake and creatine and swig it quick.

title: on its own I'm sure this is fine aside from TASTING GOD AWFUL -- but seeing as ...
body: on its own I'm sure this is fine aside from TASTING GOD AWFUL -- but seeing as any whey protein already contains bcaa's, I feel this product is just an unnecessary money-grab. not worth it

title: Warning.
body: This stuff smells absolutely horrible and tastes even worse, it's unbearable. It will absolutely ruin the flavor of ANYTHING.  The positive is that it works really really well, so much so that I still give it five stars.

title: Five Stars
body: Great taste and I don't feel hardly as sore in the mornings after my workout anymore.

title: Disgusting!!
body: Disgusting!!!!! I can't stomach this stuff. Used 3 times and then threw it away. Protein shake, juice and even a smoothie didn't cover up it up. Get the flavored stuff.

title: It took a few times to get the perfect amount that works well for me but it does ...
body: This works really well.  I have to dilute it a lot, not use a full scoop.  It took a few times to get the perfect amount that works well for me but it does give me that extra push to get through workouts

title: Another ON product that does its job. Definitely should ...
body: Another ON product that does its job. Definitely should mix with other flavored drinks though. Even though it says "unflavored," you can't get away from that chalky taste.

title: Unflavored = Rancid Flavor
body: Worst tasting thing i have ever tried (Unflavored = Rancid Flavor). I already took 4 servings and i don't think i could bear to take one more. There was no safety seal but I don't know if there was supposed to be. either way bad quality control. I wish I read the 1 star reviews before i orderd.

title: Love them!
body: I love it, but more expensive so switched over to xtend. Please lower your price so I can come back :). I love ON products!! Take their women's and mens multi vitamins, fish oil, and protein supplements.

title: No Regrets.
body: Love this stuff. Awesome for muscle recovery and the taste is decent. This powder is super fine, so if you transfer it to a different container it becomes kind of airborne and dusts you, the counters, etc.

title: Good results, bitter taste.
body: These BCAA's are great, but as stated in previous reviews, it does have an extremely bitter taste due to the fact that it doesn't have any artificial flavorings added to it. Even when I add it to my whey shake, it adds a layer of subtle bitterness. You are better off putting the tablespoon of this powder into a shot glass of water, and downing it in one go. On the performance side, I can really see a change in my recovery speed, and how I feel hardly sore a day after my workout.

title: Tastes like metal but not the good kind...
body: Tastes like zinc and copper mixed together. I though the "unflavored" flavor would taste like nothingness, but I was way off. Adding it to a flavored protein will definitely ruin the taste that you're used to.

title: Helps a lot with recovery and great quality
body: Unflavored tastes a little sour, but blends great with post workout protein shake. No doubt in quality of this product, its great BCAA's, these definitely accelerated my recovery process for next days workout. After experimentation, I found that my body performs and recovers faster while drinking BCAA's during workout, so I shifted to flavored version of these.

title: I've decided to change my life style and challenge myself by getting into a better body physique
body: Optimum Nutrition is the industry leader and I am a big fan of their product.

title: maybe for some
body: It didn't really make much of a difference for me I work out 3 to 4 days a week and I found that changing my diet around form week to week depending on how I was working out had a much greater impact on me then anything. I took it for a month and the comments about this stuff tasting bad are no joke. the only thing I found that worked was grape juice and it did work very well to cut the bad taste out.

title: Great Supplement for Weight Training
body: I used to have post-workout pain a lot after weightlifting. Then I tried doing a ketogenic diet and found I became very weak during and after the workout. I decided to add in BCAAs and lite salt to attempt to repair and provide electrolytes during exercise. It worked well. So well in fact, sometimes I wonder if I am working hard enough in the weight room. I have never quite felt this way before after weight training. I know I am making gains because I can handle more and more of a load over time. I use BCAAs all of the time now, not just while on keto. I think the difference now is that I am giving my body the opportunity to start repairing itself before it gets wore down and  DOMS (delayed onset muscle soreness) sets in. I am not saying DOMS has gone totally away, but it's gotten a ton better than it used to be, even when I was 10 years younger than I am now.

title: Need Your BCAAs to Mix Readily? This Is For You.
body: BCAAs do not mix well (they are "hydrophobic"). If you are looking for a BCAA product that mixes well with your liquid-based drink, then this product is what you want. If, however, you just want the BCAAs and want to save a bunch of money, then what you want is something from Hard Rhino (or the like). Relative to the other products out there that are not micronised ("instantised") Optimum Nutrition's product is unusually expensive. You have to pay for convenience though, I guess.

title: Go with flavored!
body: It does the job- it's a BCAA supplement from a reputable company. It's very, very powdery though, so it kind of makes a mess more than other supplements I've used. Also the unflavored version is pretty gross, but that's my own fault.

title: Good stuff
body: I think that having a BCAA supplement is very important for rebuilding and growth.  This is one of the better choices due to having the ability to mix it with anything and not have much of a flavor.  I have purchased this twice and will continue to unless some great deal comes along with another product.

title: I never start my day without it.
body: Admittedly, the taste was horrible at first.  I would hold my breath, chug it in a glass of water, and then chase it with just a shot of whatever juice I had around the house.  Now I drink it with water and no chaser.  You get used to the taste pretty quickly.  All good.  Feels good.  Just remember, you are not drinking it for the taste.

title: Tasty muscle recovery! MMMM
body: I love the taste. Smooth and mixes well. I mix this with Amino energy on days where I have to instruct spin and boot camp back to back. I use it after every strength workout and it makes recovery a lot faster. Definitely recommend the orange flavor and purchase on subscription. =)

title: Love it!!!
body: Had other BCAA powders in the past that tasted absolutely horrible, almost like fruit flavor chemical water. This powder on the otherhand is absolutely delicious and has all the proportions of the aminos that I've been looking for! Great product, and no question to the quality!

title: Mixes Great With Coffee
body: These unflavored BCAAs are great for mixing with coffee, you can't even taste it. I mix a tablespoon into a pint of coffee and sip on that before and during my workouts, my own special pre/intra workout drink. I can't say this is a magical potion that will make all your dreams come true; but, I usually have great workouts, so I keep taking it.

title: Cheapest, with no color and sugar ingredients BCAA
body: This is a best BCAA product you can find on the market. What I like is that it has no other ingredients other than BCAA. I used to try different brands and #2 in my rating is Amino X by BSN, but they put a lot of additional stuff in there. I cant understand people who tries to live healthy life and drink red, yellow, green, blue and other drinks.

title: Great BCAA for your money
body: Use these for pre-workout, during workout, and post-workout.

title: Feed your muscles!
body: This is some magic powder that helps cut down recovery time.  I'm a huge fan of BCAA's and this is a quality BCAA product.  The only thing about "unflavored" is that it tastes pretty bad.  You've gotta find something else to mix it in like Spark, or anything really with a flavor.  I personally got used to the taste and can sip on it throughout a workout.  I HIGHLY recommend this for anyone, and with the OptimumNutrition name you know you're getting quality.

title: tastes good!
body: I dont have anything to compare this to, but I think it works and it tastes yummy! It tastes like tang. I drink it in a full glass of water, and I put my glutamine in with it and this erases the strange taste that the glutamine has. I work out about 5 times a week and this has helped my muscles heal.

title: I love this pre-workout

I use a half scoop (because I'm a stimulant lightweight lol) and it's perfect for me. No jitters or stomach ache, great energy for my workout!!

body: Keeps me energised without the jitters. Only reason for 4 instead of 5 is because I got unflavoured, which is partially my fault. Other than that it's a great product!

title: Simple and great choice
body: Although it smells like dog food, I don't taste it when mixed with water or a protein shake. Try the unflavored creatine as well. Both are winners 😎

body: Dissolves well and tastes good.  Definitely recommend this as a good BCAA source.  Not sure if it is really helping my workouts, but I can't complain about the mixability or taste.

title: I don't like to take things with alot of sugar or pretend ...
body: I don't like to take things with alot of sugar or pretend sugars. This doesn't have any of that. Great product, can see results.

title: A good low calorie way to get BCAA's with flavor.

title: Chose to get unflavored because it doesn't contain any of ...
body: Chose to get unflavored because it doesn't contain any of the food dies etc nor sweeteners, the trade of is it smells and tastes funky, so I end up mixing it with all natural juices when possible or Gatorade powder.

title: One Heaping Teaspoonful of Awesome
body: A friend at my gym told me about this stuff. . She was about a hundred pounds overweight when she started at the gym and now she's the most cut, incredible athlete there so I tend to listen to what she says. She recommended the unflavored, to avoid food coloring and unnecessary sugar

title: Awesome price and provides the vitamins and nutrients I sought in making a healthy beverage.
body: Loved the taste and provides those nutrients I was looking for. Mixed this with another brand that provided the pre-workout information.

title: Great as a Mix-In!
body: I mix with Xtend Intra-Workout Catalyst Blue Raspberry so that 1) it's not quite as sweet and 2) it's a little cheaper per bottle. I do NOT drink this by itself, so I cannot attest to the flavor alone, but it is great mixed in. Highly recommend!

body: I take BCAAs daily and I've tried many different brands. This product by far offers the most bang for your buck. It comes with the same mix of amino acids as the more expensive brands, but for half the price.

title: Four Stars

title: Tastes good

title: Basic BCAA powder - add your own flavor!
body: I'm not interested in the BCAAs with tons of fake flavor and artificial sweeteners. I buy the Optimum Nutrition BCAAs because it's an inexpensive, straightforward BCAA powder. I then add TrueNutrition Premium Flavor packs (yes, they have stevia, but it's still better than the alternatives) to a whole can, which greatly improves the taste.

title: The stuff is really good, if that is what it is supposed to ...
body: The stuff is really good, if that is what it is supposed to be. Unlike many other BCAAs out there this one has the least amount of ingredients. Which means it's actually better when you're buying a supplement product. MY PROBLEM WAS the box did not have a seal on it! This is very important, I don't know who could've opened the package on the way to me. As a result of this, i just excitedly opened the thing to peel the seal off and everything went on the floor and I had to clean it.

title: Love the brand but it's bitter
body: The unflavored version of this is GROSS. It is bitter and has a weird after taste. I now see why the fruit punch flavor is so strong. But because I use it everyday and don’t want it to go to waste I still use it. I bought some of the Mio drink enhancers, which have no sugar, but have sodium and put a squirt or two of that to cover up the bitterness and it works. I bought this unflavored version because the fruit punch flavor was way too strong and I don’t really like orange. So I bought a couple different Mio flavors to squirt in so now I can have a variety and still cover the bitterness.

title: works great in smoothies and post-workout shakes

title: Good Energy

title: Game changer
body: I'm blown away by this product... namely because I was in desparate need of BCAA's and had no idea, for years. I finally have gotten serious about my training and I'm trying to build muscle going to Crossfit 5 days a week, I'm a female and so it's never been easy for me to do. What makes it so much harder is the fact that I'm so sore all the time. Sooooo sore, I thought something was wrong with me and so by recommendation of a fellow Crossfitter, I started taking BCAA's pre & post workout and it's changed my life. I can easily do 5 days a week and am already seeing gains in my physical ability based on the fact that I'm not super sore anymore well that and I'm eating quite a bit more.

title: Five Stars

title: Probably Works, Tastes Horrible
body: It's hard to say if this product has actually contributed to my added size/strength over the past couple of months, but as long as I'm making quality gains I'll keep using it. As for the taste, it's horrendous. Probably the worst thing I have ever tasted. I mix it with my whey protein shake, and have found that if I guzzle it then chase it with orange juice, it's not that bad.

title: The flavor is nice but you pay extra for it...

title: Doesn't taste that bad at all.

It does have a slightly bitter taste, but it's so minimal that it can be easily ignored. I like that I'm not putting any of that artificial flavorings/sugar in my body. After taking these BCAAs, I can now sleep through the night while my body repairs itself. No more waking up mid sleep sore or enduring what feels like growing pains. :D

title: Good stuff
body: BCAAs is a must have for anyone who is active. No matter what the goal is. And powder is definitely the way to go. cheaper and has no taste. Drink with straight water any you will barely notice the difference.

title: Tastebud Challenged
body: First of all, let me say I love ON.  They are great and all the other products I've tried from them are great.  Unfortunately, the taste of this unflavored is very bitter.  I had a hard time getting through the 8 oz of water I added to it pre-workout.  I tried it with my chocolate ON protein after my WOD and it turned my protein shake into something I couldn't finish either.  I'm not speaking to the benefits from the product, just the flavor of the unflavored powder.  I am going to try to add a little kool-aid or something to it to cut the bitterness.  I suspect it will be tolerable then.  I also expect the flavored versions of this powder would be much easier to swallow.  If you don't mind the bitterness of the unflavored it is a much better priced deal.  60 servings at a cheaper price than the 40 servings of the flavored at a higher price.  I did feel like it gave me a boost in my WOD when taken pre-workout, but I haven't used much of it because of the flavor yet, so that could be attributed to a variety of things.

title: Great BCAA product, but I recommend you DO NOT buy the unflavored kind.

title: Best BCAA on the market IMO
body: I've tried a few different BCAA powders and this one is hands down my favorite.  I take this pre-workout to ensure that the elevated amino acid levels keep my muscles from fatiguing as quickly in the gym and regardless of brand, I CAN tell a difference in muscle stamina.

title: I Now Lift Heavier with More Reps and WAY Less (to almost no) Crippling Muscle Soreness.
body: I had periods in the past where I was able to work out 2.5 - 3 hours a day 4 - 5 days a week but didn't supplement with anything more than regular creatine.  I became stronger but there was not a great change in physical appearance.  Now, working out 1 - 1.5 hours a day 3 - 5 days a week while supplementing with this product has made a HUGE difference!!  I use this product in conjunction with Whey Protein, Creatine HCL, Glutamine, Casein, and Beta-Alanine and the results are extremely satisfying.  My physique actually reflects the bounds of progress I've made in my strength training maximums!  All of the hard work in that hour at the gym is SOOOO much more worth it when I see my body fat percentage drop and my muscle growth explode (in addition to the progress in lifting heavier, running longer and faster)!

title: Quality BCAA Powder, Horrendous Taste.
body: I purchased the unflavored bcaa powder for a boost of energy before workouts, whenever I haven't eaten for a prolonged period of time. The powder does give you a high quality protein source and deserves a few stars for that. However, it taste unbelievably bad. I'm somebody who will eat things like plain yogurt, plain whey protein powder, black coffee, bland foods, and even organ meats; but this is too much even for me. I mixed it with water and had to chug it and chase it with another flavor like I was taking a strong shot of liquor. I don't how this stuff can taste this bad, but be warned if you plan on taking this stuff plain with water.

title: Taking additional BCAA on top of a balanced diet is useless, but you get what you pay for with this product
body: You get exactly what you pay for with this.  I rated it 3 stars because unless you have a specific dietary need to boost your BCAA intake as advised by a doctor, this produces no measurable benefit for body building / strength training.  Be careful falling into the supplement trap... 95% are absolutely useless and some don't even have the advertised ingredient included in them at the promised amount.

title: Five Stars

title: However these unflavored aminos are HORRIBLE to say the least

Instead they have this bitter citrus taste that will linger after a sip and it ruins just about everything else you mix with it. At least when it comes to the taste. Bought them unflavored once, never again.

title: Great product!
body: This is the third container of the optimum nutrition BCAA'S that I have gone through! I have to say this is one of the best supplements on the market not only from my experience but my personal trainer recommends it to his clients! Whether you are bulking, cutting, maintaining or just trying to get your nutrition on point I would highly recommend this product to anyone! But not only do the effects exceed all of my expectations, the taste is exactly like fruit punch! Not to mention it mixes almost instantly! The taste and the mixture have always been important to me, I have had amino acids before that have tasted like water mixed with sand but this product is nothing like that! Overall I could not ask for a better product thank you optimum nutrition!

title: can't work out without it.
body: I always had a problem with "tanking" while working out. I would start with high energy then fade out  after couple of machines. this powder stops all of that completely. now I have to watch the ceiling, so as to not work out too hard, which can through my body into overdive.. this is now a staple for me. i use with whey gold powder. between the two and an ECA stack, i have all i need. working on an abercrombie physique.

I generally mix into about 5 or 6oz with creatine and flavoring to taste. The creatine and flavoring is fine, but this stuff really throws it off! BCAA"s I've used before were more crystal-like, whereas this stuff is powdery. No more powder BCAA's for me! I've even tried adding more water, or a lot of flavoring, and nothing seems to work. It seems like a decent product overall, I am just not a fan and will stick to something else.

title: Tastes like poision and makes me nauseous. :(

Nothing works.  Even worse, now every time I drink it I get really nauseous.  It takes about twenty minutes for the feeling to pass.  It's not helping my workouts at all to spend a half hour in front of the sink wondering if I'm going to barf.

title: 1 ratio is good and a 3
body: With BCAAs the ratio is key. A 2:1:1 ratio is good and a 3:1:1 ratio is best. The ratio we care about is leucine, to valine, to iso leucine. I feel that the quality of this product is spot on and its in a good ratio to promote muscle growth. Anyone who takes BCAAs and is lifting to produce mechanical stress, meaning actually going hard in the gym along with a proper macro nutrient breakdown and diet will see a difference in size and energy. Problem is most people lack the 80% of all progress which is diet and think BCAAs or any supplement will be magic. I know BCAAs work, it is proven clinically especially for muscle gain.

title: Awful Taste

I've noticed less soreness when using it, and I have broken through a longstanding strength plateau since using it. I don't get as sore as I used to after a workout but it's hard to say if that is because of the BCAA or because I am getting workouts at a more consistent basis now than I was in the past.

title: 1 ratio is good and a 3
body: With BCAAs the ratio is key. A 2:1:1 ratio is good and a 3:1:1 ratio is best. The ratio we care about is leucine, to valine, to iso leucine. I feel that the quality of this product is spot on and its in a good ratio to promote muscle growth. Anyone who takes BCAAs and is lifting to produce mechanical stress, meaning actually going hard in the gym along with a proper macro nutrient breakdown and diet will see a difference in size and energy. Problem is most people lack the 80% of all progress which is diet and think BCAAs or any supplement will be magic. I know BCAAs work, it is proven clinically especially for muscle gain.

title: Good Aminos
body: I prefer powdered amino acids over pill form. I use these when pre-workout when training in a fasted state to help offset muscle catabolism. They help have free form amino acids in the blood during exercise so your body does not break down lean tissue to get them.Essential amino acids cannot be made by the body like most other amino acids so they must come from diet. All complete protein has essential aminos so if not training in a fasted state I would suggest a good whey protein supplement. Hope this review is helpful.
