If you feel that a BCAA supplement is a necessary component of your stack, I would highly suggest this product. The 2:1:1 ratio is one of the most recommended and this supplement is an excellent value. There are other, more expensive ones on the market, but I do not feel like they warrant the extra cost. The only reason I am giving this product 4 stars and not 5 stars is because it may seem too sweet for some palates, including mine.

title: Best BCAA I've Tried!
body: THIS TASTES AMAZING. Holy god this is such a step up from a BSN branded BCAA I got previously. Mixes great, not too strong and sits well over time. If you're looking for a great BCAA to mix and let sit, or to sip on throughout the day then this is perfect.

title: Tips on how to deal with taste
body: The powder mixes just fine in a shaker bottle, which most users of the product would be using. On flavor, you must understand that BCAAs are inherently bitter. You cannot fault ON for providing the product as described. Honestly, taking it straight isn't that bad, however, I understand that some people are highly sensitive to bitterness. If flavor is still a problem, my recommendation to treat it like bad tequila. Countering the bad taste of hard alcohol works just as well for unflavored BCAAs. Mix less than 8 ounces of water with the powder. The less volume the better, so you'll be able to gulp it down in one go. Take a small amount of salt on your tongue, gulp down the liquid, and chase with some straight lime or lemon juice. Salty is a well known counter to bitter. Prepping the tongue with pure salt helps soften the bitter shock. After gulping the BCAAs, the bitterness is well again countered with an alternative strong taste, sour. Using lemon or lime has the additional benefit of ending on a refreshing citrus note. This combination completely clears any of the rubbery bitter aftertaste. For those who want to avoid artificial flavoring or sweeteners, and prefer coming up with their own recipe, I recommend this product.

title: Keep the amino acids coming...save that muscle tone.
body: Read about this on bodybuilding.com, went thru the Jamie Eason Live Fit program....fitness model...this BCAA 1 heaping tsp with ice/water, Stevia Liquid (peppermint flavor for me)...shake/mix in the bottle you take to the gym, drink before, during and after workouts!!

body: You are better off drinking Kapri Sun during your workout. This is incredibly sweet, literally like drinking candy or some very delicious fruit punch. I don't see any performance differences in my workout. If anything - I think this may just spike my insulin during a workout.

title: Tastes like asprin
body: It says flavorless. It tastes like crap. It will change of anything you put it in. If you're smart and savvy, buy a protein powder with BCAA's already mixed in. Not worth the added expense... I can't see enough payoff to supplement by itself. Don't know how to rate that; so I gave it 3 stars.

title: Best mixing bcaa ever
body: I love how well this bcaa mixes. The previous brand I used (GNC'S own product) would create a thick foam and was generally very annoying to drink. this one is practically gone within seconds. I add some lemon juice to it and a tiny bit of sugar and salt, my own version of gatorade.

title: "Unflavored"
body: I like what BCAAs do for my body and this is a very good blend.  Im just not sure I would call it "Unflavored".  It has a definate funky taste and smell.  Best when masked with a water enhancer.

title: This is the worst flavor I have ever had period
body: This is the worst flavor I have ever had period. Wish I could return and exchange for another. Love this company but the taste is just bad.

title: Five Stars

title: BCAA works
body: I take BCAA 3x per day along with my health & workout routine.  I also use Creatine & Glutamine. All combined, I feel excellent & more energetic.  I've slowly incorporated all, researched, & decided on the amount that works for me.  I will need a few more months for a completed review but I am extremely happy so far. No complaints.  Also, easy to use... for me, I don't mind mixing in just a glass of water before starting my day...it takes a little like unflavored dust but I can drink without any problems.  I will re-purchase soon!

title: seems to work
body: I have been using this for a while now and it appears to be doing what it should be doing.  But my god the taste.  I use to try and mask it with lemon and honey but now I just take it straight since all that did was add lemon and honey to the horrible taste.

title: Good stuff
body: I am pleased with the powder BCAA from ON.  I agree that it is slightly bitter, and I wouldn't take it with water, but it's not horrible.  I've had multi-vitamins taste just as bad.  I mix my ON BCAA powder with 1/4 cup of pineapple juice and drink it like a shot.  The juice is sweet and masks the bitterness of the BCAA pretty good.  I get a slight bitter aftertaste but nothing bad.  I've just started taking it last week so I can't yet speak to the effectiveness of the product on my muscle building but I'm confident it is doing what it's supposed to.

title: Not unflavored at all! But product works
body: Not unflavored at all I mix this with cookies & cream whey protein and it makes my mix sour. Almost as if it's bad milk or protein. However it does the trick have substantially less soar after workouts which is the only reason it's getting 2 stars

title: YASSSS
body: Tastes really good, doesn't leave an after taste, and the flavor stacks well with my pre-workout. I drink it to help with my DOMs and I can tell the difference from when I train without it to when I train with it. Highly recommend.

title: Horrible bitter taste
body: This says "unflavored" but it has the most disgusting flavor.  I even tried mixing it with my favorite drink, and I still couldn't finish it.  Very bitter horrible taste.  I bought this and had to request a return.

title: Horrible smell, bad taste
body: So I recently bought this jug of unflavored BCAAs. I use Optimum products on a regular basis and LOVE them, but I have to say the BCAA I just picked up is horrible! It smells like horse feed. If you've ever been to a Tractor Supply Co and you go into the animal feed section, that is what the BCAAs smell like. They also taste bad! I've tried mixing it with my Optimum Amino Energy, Chocolate 100% Whey and Strawberry Mass Gainer but you can still taste the BCCAs and it's not a good taste. I've only been using it for a week, so I'm not 100% sure if it's actually doing anything for me, but I will say the taste is horrible! Try getting a flavored version if you're going to try this out or mix it with a very strong fruit juice. I was disappointed in the bad smell/taste. I would not buy this product again, but I will still buy other Optimum products.

title: tastes horrible-God awful bitter
body: This powder is hideously bitter. No way my dog is gonna eat it-I'm just glad I tasted it before trying it on her. For what this cost I could have bought her 6 pounds of hamburger and got the same amino acids.

title: Weird Phenomena

The following day I went to use this and the spoon handle was all curled up! I thought, "OK, maybe I put in a bent spoon". So I took a different plastic spoon (and I do store this in my refrigerator, if that matters) and what do you know? The very next day the spoon was curled over like it had been set too close to flame! Is this normal? It can't be, right???  Anyone else know of this happening? I just entered some keywords into Yahoo search and nothing came up. This is a little scary.

title: Best BCAA powder I've ever tried
body: I'm no stranger to BCAA products, from Extend to Purple Wraath to plain powders this is by far the best one I've had. I only tried it once, but it was way better than I thought it would be. I've had BCAAs in powder form before straight from the source and it never mixed well. Even with a blender bottle, I'd always have this weird froth. BCAAs are never going to taste well, that's why products like Extend pack it with a ridiculous amount of sucralose to cover up the taste. For me that stuff is just too sweet thats why I stick to the straight powder. I picked this product because it's one of few that contains Ajipure BCAAs. They're the purest and best form of BCAAs I know of, and you can tell. I tried it once by just putting the powder straight in my mouth and washing it down with water. Usually with regular BCAA powder this would result in tons of 'flakes' of BCAAs floating around in my mouth. I took a swig of water and swished it around and almost instantly the powder dissolved leaving BCAA flavored water in my mouth. If I had to stick with BCAAs this would always be my first choice. Best part is you can add this to any drink.

title: new formula contains lecithin
body: this product used to contain 100% bcaas with no other ingredients. the container i received last month cost me the same amount but now includes soy lecithin. the container doesnt say if its non-GMO soy lecithin, so its probably derived from GMO soy, but thats besides the point.

title: Dissolves well
body: I've been using NOW brand BCAA powder in the past, but decided to give this a try.  For pure BCAAs, it's a much finer powder than the stuff I've used in the past, and while it still tastes like chalk going down, and ruins anything it's mixed in with, it's a lot easier to mix than the other stuff that gets chunky.  So for pure BCAAs (without added sugar and junk), you probably can't beat this stuff.

title: Helps relieve and prevent soreness
body: I was pretty shocked at how well these pills did in preventing soreness. Even after taking a week off, and increasing weights, I was barely sore. I took two of these about 45 minutes before my workout, and then another 2 after, and that did the trick. I can't speak for increasing gains or anything of that nature, but for alleviating soreness, this works better than ibuprofen.

Because you will be playing the mud tuba in no time.

title: Still goin'!
body: The recommended dosage is 4 pills with each meal.  Having never taken anything like this I opted to go with 2 to see how things went.  After several hours I developed extreme abdominal pain that turned out to be gas.  I'm not certain if it was caused directly by the BCAA's or the small helping of beans I had at dinner.  Either way I would tell folks to start out with a smaller than recommended dosage.  You want to find out how it affects you first before continuing.

title: It just works.

title: Best Mix out there!
body: Best Mix out there!  And glad that it is reasonably priced.  I have gone through the entire gambit of Amino Acid chains, since I started exploring health nutrition in my early 20's.  Now that I'm almost 40, and back to 'getting in the best shape of my life' (at least for this age) again, I can say that this mix by TwinLabs has by far showed me the best results of adds, builds, and recovery out of any of the others.  I have gone from the cheap-processed stuff in Japan (that floats on water- no really); to the designer stuff at GNC.  Overall, I will undoubtedly stay with this mix; especially at price point and results.  Thanks for showing the rest of them what right looks like!

title: I LOVE it. Used for intermittent fasting workouts.
body: I enjoy doing the intermittent fasting and working out during the fasting time to skyrocket the weight loss. I heard that the body eats a little muscle with the fat if you do this, so I got this supplement to prevent that from happening. I'm a mother to 2 under 3yrs old and as much as I need to get healthy, if my body feels battered from weights it makes it hard to do it since I'm in pain running around after my kids all day. I took this half hour before my work out, and the next morning I only felt a twinge of pain in a couple muscles... normally I feel it all over for days. THIS STUFF WORKS. For the first time, I feel I can get a great quality work out and not worry about taking care of my babies with pain afterwords. Best of both worlds. I will definitely buy again. I noticed zero side effects and I even have hypothyroid. So I'm glad I did it.

title: My skin is awesome. It was looking aged and I had acne

title: Iron Endurance Capsules
body: Many products for sale fail to measure up to the hype, but these capsules deliver.  I usually lose energy late in the day on handyman projects, or after a few holes on the back nine when golfing.  Add this capsule to a solid breakfast, and I have the endurance of a much younger man.  I experienced none of the "jangled nerves" that often accompanies energy supplements, but rather a calm determined-to-finish endurance.  I searched the web for bad side effects, and found no real caution.  However, I use the supplement sparingly, including it only on days when I need to go the distance.  It's not really expensive, and I am glad I gave it a try.  I encourage you to give it a fair try, remembering that my results were more subtle at first than most products.  I recall feeling quite pleased with myself to be able to work late into the day, when I needed to do so.

title: It works!
body: I'm a physician and have been weight training for well over a decade. In the past I've been leery of supplements or workout 'boosters'. But as I'm approaching 40, as the metabolism slows, and I don't get up with a spring in my step anymore; I thought I'd give this product a try. I can say without hesitation that it has increased my endurance, stamina, strength, and recovery time. Given that it's a natural peptide found in food, I avoid the side-effects found in stimulant loaded products. Give it a try. I know I have no regrets.

It requires you take it on an empty stomach. This is hard for me to do since I workout so early. I take it 30 minutes before my workout and then drink my protein shake on my way to my fitness group. It is possible my routine might be interfering with some of the its effectiveness doing it this way.

I like that this supplement has limited ingredients, unlike the mix able powders that have artificial colors, artificial sweeteners, chemicals, etc... I will be ordering again for sure!

body: I was a middle aged, overweight woman with chronic fatigue and a slew of health issues(hypo thyroid, pre-diabetes, anemia, eczema, shortness of breath, heart palpitations, anxiety attacks, etc.)

title: Surprising results!
body: I have only been taking this supplement for a week, however I notice and dramatic difference.  I recently started a low carb diet, that typically leaves me moody and lacking energy to workout, but for weight loss it seems to be the only thing that works for me (low carb).  This week, I've added the BCAA capsules about 30 minutes before my workout and I have all the energy I need to beast through my routine. It also curbs my appetite some, because following my workout I'm not starving like usual.  This week alone, I've worked out during lunch for about 45 minutes, combining weights, and intervals on the treadmill.  In one week, taking these supplements before my workouts and maintaining the low carb diet, I've lost 5lbs.  This is a big deal for me, because as I get older, the slower the weight comes off, so 5lbs in a week is better than great!  I have about 30lbs I'd like to lose, and I'm feeling pretty optimistic.  I don't think it's a placebo effect, I think the supplements actually work.  Let's just hope it doesn't wear off.  I'll follow-up in a few weeks.

title: Great product!
body: This supplement has really made a difference in the level of soreness I feel after lifting weights. I like that this supplement has limited ingredients, unlike the mix able powders that have artificial colors, artificial sweeteners, chemicals, etc... I will be ordering again for sure!

title: Iron Endurance Capsules
body: Many products for sale fail to measure up to the hype, but these capsules deliver.  I usually lose energy late in the day on handyman projects, or after a few holes on the back nine when golfing.  Add this capsule to a solid breakfast, and I have the endurance of a much younger man.  I experienced none of the "jangled nerves" that often accompanies energy supplements, but rather a calm determined-to-finish endurance.  I searched the web for bad side effects, and found no real caution.  However, I use the supplement sparingly, including it only on days when I need to go the distance.  It's not really expensive, and I am glad I gave it a try.  I encourage you to give it a fair try, remembering that my results were more subtle at first than most products.  I recall feeling quite pleased with myself to be able to work late into the day, when I needed to do so.

It requires you take it on an empty stomach. This is hard for me to do since I workout so early. I take it 30 minutes before my workout and then drink my protein shake on my way to my fitness group. title: Please Read
body: I took two doses. Each time I had a stinging pain in my chest. I am a healthy, mid thirties and have been exercising for a while. I also would have mental foginesses and fatigue. For me it did not cut down recovery time. If anything I noticed more delayed onset muscle soreness. That's the bad. The good, and only reason it has two stars is the customer service. I shot them a message simply stating I'm not satisfied and would like a refund. Without argument or hassle they returned what I paid. The product may not work for me. The seller seems true to their word.

title: It definitely worked and I could notice a difference in my appearance pretty quickly. My only gripe is the flavor
body: I took this to help me maintain my hard work in the gym. It definitely worked and I could notice a difference in my appearance pretty quickly. My only gripe is the flavor. It was almost like swallowing a bunch of BC powders. I had to psych myself up just to drink it or chase it with something strong because the aftertaste was way worse. Maybe it's just the lemonade flavor.

title: bad taste/good results
body: First of all, it does give me a boost in energy. I know that's not what it's supposed to be about, but I can tell when I've taken it and when I haven't based on how I feel during my workouts!! Second, it tastes kinda gross. My trick, I add a crystal light packet into the bottle with it and I'm fine! Third, can tell a different in my recovery time when I use this product.

title: It tastes like an average quality lemonade
body: I bought it to improve recovery. I have not noticed any visible improvement. I do not care about the taste so I put a serving in my mouth and chase it with water. It would not mix with water. It tastes like an average quality lemonade. I believe you should buy it for retaining muscle during cutting. Was'nt a big help with recovery. All said and done, I would but it again because its the cheapest and I do not plan to spend any more money on BCAAs.

title: Contains sucralose
body: I was disappointed to discover this product is sweetened with sucralose (generic name for Splenda).  It also contains artificial flavors.  I prefer to avoid artificial sweeteners, and was surprised to find it in a "health product".

title: Should have paid more attention to other users reviews
body: the taste is nothing to rave about and doesn't mix well.  I purchased this item purely on cost which is my mistake.  When I do use this, I mix it with other bcaa powders which helps the mixability just a tad or I just dump a large scoop into my mouth and swish down with a healthy glass of water.  If you are on a budget and taste is not a major factor, this might work for you, but I think there are better options at slightly higher price points.

title: Needs more lemon flavor!!!
body: I get all of my bcaa's and glutamine in one stop. It is a great recovery powder for having a mixture like that. I dont have much muscle ache or (doms) the next day after putting in a hard workout. Only reason 4 stars is cause it does not have much flavor at all. Its very mild lemonade as if i put a couple of drops of lemon in the water.

title: Disappointed
body: I've used MRM BCAA natural in other flavors... this one had a weak flavor, which frankly I don't care about as long as it works, but I noticed that it didn't have the same impact/effect as the other natural flavors

title: I dont take two at a time like the bottle says
body: so far they do what they are suppose to only started taking these for a week so far. havent noticed alot of change. I decided to take these cause I  work in a really hard labor job. I thought it will help with muscles building while I work. SO far I do notice some changes  but not sure if it these or other vitamins I am taking as well along with this. ONE i do know is from this is my appetite is back. I am always hungry but they are a diet supplement so I can understand this and I just need to control it and I will adjust to it. I am not overweight by any  means 5'6" and about 130 lbs female I am no where near fat so I can so understand the hungry feeling. I dont take two at a time like the bottle says. I figured with my size and my experience in stuff like this I decided to take one pill two times a day I take one in the morning and one at night. With in a half hr to a hr from taking it I notice my hunger is on full force. SO I normally take the pills and then 15 mins later will eat something filling crackers and water bread with peanutbutter ect. something to make me feel full until its time to eat that is. works well for me and I notice more energy as well. I get up in the morning and I am more awake vs groggy. but over time will have to see. like I said its only been about a week.

title: Doesn't do much of anything
body: Let me put it this way. In five years as a prime member and after an average of about 20 orders a months this is the first thing I was frustrated enough about to write a review. I've was originally taking bulk superments bcaas, they are nothing short of amazing. I ordered these caps to make it easier on my wife to take bcaas. When she wasn't in to taking them I used the bottle instead of ordering more bulk supplements. I virtually felt no difference with this capsules. I still what get fatigued about 30 minutes into a heavy lifting session. With the bulk supplements powder I swear I would leave an hour long heavy lifting session with more energy than I did when I started.

title: Works, But Huge Pills
body: I got these in hope that they'll soothe muscle recovery by reducing some muscle soreness. So far, it has certainly done so, but damn are the pills huge. While I can still swallow them because I'm not a bitch, they're still the largest pill I take out of the nearly dozen various supplements I take. Still not a reason for me to deduct a star, just a forewarning to those who can't handle large pills.

title: Increases rate of recovery in the muscle fibers, helps reduce muscle soreness the next day (DOMS.)
body: I take 2 right before my workout, and another 2 right after (my workout is typically 1 1/2-2 hrs long) and it helps me not feel as sore the next day.  And I'm good to go for another 2 hr workout the very next day without feeling all tight and sore in my muscles.

title: Great product, HUGE pills
body: I take BCAA every time I do fasted cardio or plan a hard workout. I love the convenience of tablets so I can keep them in my gym bag and take 30 minutes before my exercise. These are really big tablets so be careful to take one at a time. Would be 5 stars if they were a little smaller. Otherwise it's an amazing product and exactly what anyone needs who is doing athletic activity to preserve lean muscle tissue from being used as energy.

title: Great BCAA! Really feel it working everyday! No after taste
body: Just finished the first bottle and ordered another and am almost done with that, I feel the difference and plan on using this as my primary BCAA supplement! I have been using it daily for 3 months and really feel the difference. I ran out for a couple days waiting for the next order to come in and I really felt not taking them for the few days! I would highly recommend this to anyone! We really enjoy trying and testing different products and reviewing them. When we are purchasing items the first place we look is the review section to see what experiences other shoppers have had with a particular item. title: Contains Soy!
body: Contains soybean oil and soy lecithin. I admit it's my fault I somehow missed these ingredients while researching it. It all seemed like a good product and if you can tolerate soy it is. Serving size is 4 softgels which give you 8 IU of Vit. E., 16 mg of Vit B-6, 1,200 mg of L-Leucine,  500 mg of L-Isoleucine, 500 mg of L-Valine. I think you can get higher dosage of BCAA in other brands with not as many additives. Other ingredients: Soybean oil, Gelatin, Glycerin, Soy Lecithin, Titanium Dioxide Color. I'm back to the drawing board.

body: I choose the rating of an 4 out of 5 because it did not really WOW me. For me, it took a couple of week for me to find a time and a method to choke these huge pills down. However, around mid day I start to crash and after swallowing 3-4 of these pills it provides me with enough energy for the rest of the day without keeping me up all night. As for the pill size, I choked on them for the first 2 weeks, but I have never been a pill taker. But the tick is to get the pills to the back of the throat to the point its on the edge of sliding down, THEN SWALLOW. Ahh smooth transit from the mouth to the stomach without getting stuck.

title: Overall Great Product.
body: I choose the rating of an 4 out of 5 because it did not really WOW me. For me, it took a couple of week for me to find a time and a method to choke these huge pills down. In the morning, I always use the C4 pre-workout for the immense amount of energy it provides. However, around mid day I start to crash and after swallowing 3-4 of these pills it provides me with enough energy for the rest of the day without keeping me up all night. As for the pill size, I choked on them for the first 2 weeks, but I have never been a pill taker. But the tick is to get the pills to the back of the throat to the point its on the edge of sliding down, THEN SWALLOW. Ahh smooth transit from the mouth to the stomach without getting stuck.

title: Met Rx BCAA's
body: Excellent product, excellent services highly recommend, for those starting out in weight training I recommend just the 4 caps after working out for those more advanced 4 before and 4 immediately after to keep your body fueled with amino acids to grow on.

title: Wonderful Formula, added vitamins for better absorption, easy to swallow soft gels.  Great brand.
body: Met-Rx is a worldwide recognized brand of supplements.  They sell this BCAA soft gel in a dose of 2200 combine mg, and added B-6 that is believed to increase BCAA metabolism and usage in the body.  The bottle supplies 180 soft gels.  The price point is amazing and the soft gels are easy to swallow.  The recommended dosage of this supplement is 4 soft gels immediately after your workout with an optional 4 before your workout.  If you chose to do both this would be a total of 4400 mg of the three BCAA's in the blend, 1600% of your daily recommended B-6, and 50% of your recommended daily allowance of vitamin E.  Even in such large quantities, none of these are harmful amounts.

title: Contains Soy!
body: Contains soybean oil and soy lecithin. I admit it's my fault I somehow missed these ingredients while researching it. It all seemed like a good product and if you can tolerate soy it is. Serving size is 4 softgels which give you 8 IU of Vit. E., 16 mg of Vit B-6, 1,200 mg of L-Leucine,  500 mg of L-Isoleucine, 500 mg of L-Valine. I think you can get higher dosage of BCAA in other brands with not as many additives. Other ingredients: Soybean oil, Gelatin, Glycerin, Soy Lecithin, Titanium Dioxide Color. I'm back to the drawing board.

title: This stuff is good, but I only got 179 tablets.

title: One Star

title: If a product is derived from natural ingredients it can mix with water perfect. Break open a cap and stir
body: Compared to optimum nutrition's BCAA supps. This is junk. The serving is four caps and you are barely getting any branched chain aminos. Another downfall is the purity test. If a product is derived from natural ingredients it can mix with water perfect. Break open a cap and stir, and stir, and stir. It stays a glob. Optimum's goes in the water and with one quick stir its gone. The reason I don't hate it is because the caps are very easy to swallow. The packaging has a pop top so its very convenient.

title: It's great tasting and doesn't disturb my digestive system at all
body: My go-to BCAA supplement! It's great tasting and doesn't disturb my digestive system at all, even if I consume it while working out. Definitely helps keep me going in the weight room and on my long runs (instead of gu's or gels). Love this.

title: They all taste great - like high end Gatorade but sweeter
body: I prefer the Lime flavor after trying all of them.  They all taste great -  like high end Gatorade but sweeter.  BCAA's make your muscle soreness very minimal - I miss having it when I forget to take to the gym.

title: Great flavor, seems to prevent muscle loss!
body: Due to injury and subsequent surgery, I've been unable to workout for a little while. Decided to get BCAAs for two reasons: 1) to prevent/slow muscle loss during my off time, and 2) encourage water intake. These BCAAs fulfilled both very well.

title: Quick Recovery and Great Taste!
body: My significant other mixes 1 scoop of this BCAA Supplement with 8oz of water every day after his morning workout. The supplement mixes together well and is not gritty or 'sandy' at all. He says the drink goes down smooth and tastes like Tropical Punch Hi-C. It works awesome for muscle recovery which is usually much needed after his workouts. There are days where he feels as though he could squeeze in a second workout later in the day if it were needed. He has been using this product for about a week and prefers this brand/flavor as opposed to the alternate ones he has used in the past. We will definitely be repeat customers!

title: Cellucor betta BCAA  are the best
body: Cellucor betta BCAA are the best with results and taste, i've tried a few and this one so far is the one giving real noticeable results. 2:1:1 with 2.5 L-Leucine + B Alanine is the best combination. for those who doesn't like sweet taste of your workout drink is perfect!

title: This is the stuff
body: I personally love this stuff. It is non stimulant so I can take it before bed and I've noticed my muscles are much fuller with BCAA. You just have to make sure to work out when taking this stuff, this is NOT a meal replacement, rather a support system for your body when you put it through demanding physical activity.

title: Love this product
body: My wife and I use this during workouts from a recommendation from a personal trainer. Personally, it has helped me focus during workouts, gives me a little bit more push, but without the jittery feeling that a pre-workout might. We both like the flavor, it takes like a tropical drink, but definitely not too sugary or overpowering.

title: Works for me!
body: Saw this on top of a friend's fridge.  He swore by it.  I went home and ordered it off Amazon.  I am impressed with the results.  I have used it consistently for the last two weeks, and I can 100% feel the difference in my muscle mass.  I don't try a bunch of supplements,  but this works for me, and I would recommend it.

title: Tasty and effective, but perhaps misleadingly labled
body: VERY strongly flavored. I dilute this into a full liter of water for the sake of staying anabolic all day, and it's plenty of flavor for the whole bottle. It's worth noting that this is actually FIFTEEN servings, not thirty, of the amounts advertised on the front.

title: Mislead by picture of product
body: Ordered latest formula of BCAA  (B-BCAA) and received the older formula. Very disappointed mainly because it was from the manufacturer. Be careful and don't trust the picture of the item you order, big difference in the product.

title: Best BCAA on the market
body: Tried watermelon and lemon lime. Lemon lime is 10 times better tasting. I switched to Muscle Pharm's BCAA this month and wished I would have stuck with Cellucor.  Muscle Pharm's BCAA tastes like I'm drinking watered down chalk. Highly highly recommend the Cellucor lemon lime. Tastes like a tasty sports drink. Enjoy the flavor!!! Cellucor has everyone beat on tast. Also switched from Cellucor's C4 prework out to Muscle Pharm's prework out, "Assault". Again, does not compete with C4. Recommend C4 over Assault. I normally don't write these reviews but I felt I should assist in this topic. Don't want someone to waste their money like I did. Love Cory Gregory's work outs but I'm not a fan of his Muscle Pharm products now.

title: It's Okay

title: great product, i still prefer Modern BCAA due to ...
body: great product, i still prefer Modern BCAA due to size and price point, more bang for ur buck, but this was an excellent product and I will purchase again. Mixabilty and flavor was great, definitely gave me energy to finish my workout.

title: It burns!
body: This doesn't tingle at all, it flat out burns. I started by taking only one scoop in about 20oz of water instead of the suggested two, and I wanted to peel my skin off 5 minutes after drinking it. My lips started to feel funny, then my hands started to itch, and then my ears, and then my eyes. My eyes, y'all. They itched like I was having a horrible reaction to pollen or something. Ten minutes later, my entire body was on fire and I wanted to die. I hopped into the shower and began to scrub myself, hoping that the friction and heated water would ease the itchy, burning sensation, and it did help a tiny bit. But as soon as I got out the shower, the burning, itching sensation was back full force. All I could do was lay on my bed in a towel, thinking about how I wanted to skin myself alive and run through a sprinkler of peroxide and how that would feel much better than this. The horrible feeling lasted for a good 30 minutes. Since then, I take only half of one scoop in 20oz of water. (Hey, I bought it, right? May as well use it up, but slowly.) A faint burning/ "tingling" sensation is still present, but it's not too bad as long as I occupy myself and try not to think about it. And as far as recovery? Well, I'm still sore the next day, but I guess I'm okay seeing as how I have never, and will never, take the full recommended dosage. Maybe I'm just sensitive to the amino acids, but what I felt did not equate to a tingle at all.

title: Great product but pricey

title: awesome

Two scoops is a bit strong. Three scoops just tastes waaaaay too wrong. But drinking this during workouts definitely helps to push extra reps to finish your sets strong when lifting weights. thumbs up!

I also ditched the bigger scoop for the scoop size that comes with the C4 Extreme to help the taste.  I think it works ok, but the taste is bad enough I will not be getting it again. title: Best BCAA on the market
body: Tried watermelon and lemon lime. Lemon lime is 10 times better tasting. I switched to Muscle Pharm's BCAA this month and wished I would have stuck with Cellucor.  Muscle Pharm's BCAA tastes like I'm drinking watered down chalk. Highly highly recommend the Cellucor lemon lime. Tastes like a tasty sports drink. Enjoy the flavor!!! Cellucor has everyone beat on tast. Also switched from Cellucor's C4 prework out to Muscle Pharm's prework out, "Assault". Again, does not compete with C4. Recommend C4 over Assault. I normally don't write these reviews but I felt I should assist in this topic. Don't want someone to waste their money like I did. Love Cory Gregory's work outs but I'm not a fan of his Muscle Pharm products now.
